body.p: When the Unicode characters that are visible in a text viewer or editor are not enough and you need to see the byte values of each character of a document, you can start the hex viewer that is available on the Tools menu. It has two panels: the characters are rendered in the right panel and the bytes of each character are displayed in the left panel. There is a 1:1 correspondence between the characters and their byte representation: the byte representation of a character is displayed in the same matrix position of the left panel as the character in the matrix of the right panel.
To open a file in Hex Viewer use the File Open action. Alternatively, you can drag a file and drop it in the Hex Viewer panel.
